New Records: The Mets became the first team since the 2002 Angels to avoid striking out in a postseason game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso got the party started with a three-run homer in the first
Starling Marte (four hits, three of which were doubles)
Jesse Winker (two hits, including an RBI triple)
Francisco Alvarez (three hits, including a double)
Ryne Stanek and Edwin Díaz combined for the final thirteen outs of the ballgame
Alonso demonstrated his elite power with his first-inning homer on a pitch that was about a foot over the ground
Post-Match Reflections: The 2024 Mets have shown time and time again that they should never be counted out.
The odds might still be against the Mets, but don't tell them that.
The Mets’ performance last night allowed fans to dream on another improbable comeback from the team they love.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Temptations performed “My Girl” before the ballgame
Carlos Mendoza finally re-inserted Jeff McNeil into the lineup last night, and the former batting champ responded with two sacrifice flies
Others: The odds might still be against the Mets, but don't tell them that.
